sentences.zh: 昔周監於二代，三聖制法，立爵五等，封國八百，同姓五十有餘。

translations.literal: Formerly Zhou observed the two dynasties, three sages established laws, established five ranks of nobility, enfeoffed eight hundred states, same surname fifty plus.
translations.idiomatic: Formerly, the Zhou observed the Xia and Shang dynasties, and the three sages established laws, creating five ranks of nobility and enfeoffing eight hundred states, with more than fifty being of the same surname.

sentences.zh: 周公、康叔建於魯、衛，各數百里；

translations.literal: Zhou Gong, Kang Shu established in Lu, Wei, each several hundred li;
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou and Kang Shu were established in Lu and Wei, each with territories several hundred li in extent;

sentences.zh: 太公於齊，亦五侯九伯之地。

translations.literal: Taigong in Qi, also five marquises nine earls' territory.
translations.idiomatic: Taigong in Qi also possessed territory equal to that of five marquises and nine earls.

sentences.zh: 詩載其制曰：「介人惟藩，大師惟垣。

translations.literal: Poetry records their system saying: 'Great men as screens, great masters as walls.
translations.idiomatic: The Poetry records their system, saying: 'Great men serve as screens, great ministers as walls.

sentences.zh: 大邦惟屏，大宗惟翰。

translations.literal: Great states as screens, great clans as pillars.
translations.idiomatic: Great states serve as screens, great clans as pillars.

sentences.zh: 懷德惟寧，宗子惟城。

translations.literal: Cherish virtue as peace, clan sons as walls.
translations.idiomatic: Cherishing virtue brings peace, clan sons serve as walls.

sentences.zh: 母俾城壞，毋獨斯畏。」

translations.literal: Do not let walls collapse, do not fear this alone.'
translations.idiomatic: Do not let the walls collapse, do not stand alone in fear.'

sentences.zh: 所以親親賢賢，褒表功德，關諸盛衰，深根固本，為不可拔者也。

translations.literal: This is to cherish relatives and honor worthies, commend and display meritorious deeds, relate to prosperity and decline, deeply root and solidify foundation, making it unpullable.
translations.idiomatic: This was to cherish relatives and honor the worthy, commend and display meritorious deeds, connecting them to prosperity and decline, deeply rooting and solidifying the foundation, making it unshakeable.

sentences.zh: 故盛則周、邵相其治，致刑錯；

translations.literal: Therefore when flourishing then Zhou, Shao administered their governance, led to punishment suspended;
translations.idiomatic: Therefore, when flourishing, Zhou and Shao administered their governance, leading to punishments being set aside;

sentences.zh: 衰則五伯扶其弱，與共守。

translations.literal: When declining then five hegemons supported their weakness, together guarded.
translations.idiomatic: When declining, the Five Hegemons supported their weakness and guarded together.

sentences.zh: 自幽、平之後，日以陵夷，至虖阨挢河洛之間，分為二周，有逃責之臺，被竊鈇之言。

translations.literal: From You, Ping afterwards, day by day declining, reached oppressed between Yellow River Luo River, divided into two Zhou, had escape responsibility platform, suffered stolen axe words.
translations.idiomatic: From after Kings You and Ping, it declined day by day, until oppressed between the Yellow and Luo Rivers, divided into Eastern and Western Zhou, with platforms for escaping responsibility and words about stolen axes.

sentences.zh: 然天下謂之共主，彊大弗之敢傾。

translations.literal: Yet the realm called them common lord, strong great dared not overturn them.
translations.idiomatic: Yet the realm still called them the common lord, and no strong power dared overturn them.

sentences.zh: 歷載八百餘年，數極德盡，既於王赧，降為庶人，用天年終。

translations.literal: Passed years eight hundred plus, fate extreme virtue exhausted, reached King Nan, descended to commoner, used natural lifespan ended.
translations.idiomatic: After more than eight hundred years, when fate had run its course and virtue was exhausted, it reached King Nan, who descended to commoner status and ended with a natural death.

sentences.zh: 號位已絕於天下，尚猶枝葉相持，莫得居其虛位，海內無主，三十餘年。

translations.literal: Title position already ended in realm, still yet branches leaves mutually held, none could occupy its empty position, within seas no master, thirty plus years.
translations.idiomatic: Their royal title and position had already ended in the realm, yet the branches and leaves still held each other, with no one able to occupy the empty throne, leaving the empire without a master for more than thirty years.

sentences.zh: 秦據勢勝之地，騁狙詐之兵，蠶食山東，壹切取勝。

translations.literal: Qin occupied advantageous position land, galloped cunning deceitful troops, silkworm eating east of mountains, completely took victory.
translations.idiomatic: Qin occupied strategically advantageous territory, deployed cunning and deceitful troops, gradually encroaching eastward of the mountains, and completely achieved victory.

sentences.zh: 因矜其所習，自任私知，姍笑三代，盪滅古法，竊自號為皇帝，而子弟為��夫，內亡骨肉本根之輔，外亡尺土藩翼之衛。

translations.literal: Therefore proud of their habits, self-relied private wisdom, mocked three dynasties, destroyed ancient laws, usurped self-called emperor, and sons brothers as petty officials, internally without flesh blood root foundation auxiliary, externally without inch land screen wing guard.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore proud of their customs, relying on private wisdom, they mocked the Three Dynasties, destroyed ancient laws, usurped the title of emperor for themselves, made their sons and brothers petty officials, internally lacking the support of flesh-and-blood foundations, externally lacking even an inch of land for protective wings.

sentences.zh: 陳、吳奮其白挺，劉、項隨而斃之。

translations.literal: Chen, Wu brandished their white clubs, Liu, Xiang followed and destroyed them.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Sheng and Xiang Yu brandished their white clubs, while Liu Bang and Xiang Yu followed and destroyed them.

sentences.zh: 故曰，周過其曆，秦不及期，國勢然也。

translations.literal: Therefore said, Zhou exceeded its calendar, Qin did not reach period, state power thus.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore it is said: Zhou exceeded its allotted time, Qin did not reach its period—the power of states is thus.

sentences.zh: 漢興之初，海內新定，同姓寡少，懲戒亡秦孤立之敗，於是剖裂疆土，立二等之爵。

translations.literal: Han rise beginning, within seas newly settled, same surname few little, warned against perished Qin isolation defeat, therefore divided territory, established two ranks nobility.
translations.idiomatic: At the beginning of Han's rise, the empire was newly settled, with few of the same surname, learning from the lesson of Qin's isolation and defeat, therefore they divided the territory and established two ranks of nobility.

sentences.zh: 功臣侯者百有餘邑，尊王子弟，大啟九國。

translations.literal: Merit ministers marquises hundred plus fiefs, honored prince sons brothers, greatly opened nine states.
translations.idiomatic: Meritorious ministers were made marquises with more than a hundred fiefs, princes and their brothers were honored, and nine great states were established.

sentences.zh: 自鴈門以東，盡遼陽，為燕、代。

translations.literal: From Yanmen eastward, reached Liaoyang, became Yan, Dai.
translations.idiomatic: From Yanmen eastward to Liaoyang became Yan and Dai.

sentences.zh: 常山以南，太行左轉，度河、濟，漸于海，為齊、趙。

translations.literal: Changshan southward, Taihang left turned, crossed Yellow River, Ji, approached sea, became Qi, Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: South of Changshan, turning left along the Taihang Mountains, crossing the Yellow River and Ji River, approaching the sea, became Qi and Zhao.

sentences.zh: 穀、泗以往，奄有龜、蒙，為梁、楚。

translations.literal: Gu, Si onward, encompassed Gui, Meng, became Liang, Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Beyond Gu and Si, encompassing Gui and Meng, became Liang and Chu.

sentences.zh: 東帶江、湖，薄會稽，為荊吳。

translations.literal: East bordered Jiang, Hu, approached Kuaiji, became Jing Wu.
translations.idiomatic: Eastward bordering the Jiang and Hu regions, approaching Kuaiji, became Jing and Wu.

sentences.zh: 北界淮瀕，略廬、衡，為淮南。

translations.literal: North bordered Huai banks, included Lu, Heng, became Huainan.
translations.idiomatic: Northward bordering the Huai River banks, including Lu and Heng, became Huainan.

sentences.zh: 波漢之陽，亙九嶷，為長沙。

translations.literal: Rippled Han south, extended Jiuyi, became Changsha.
translations.idiomatic: Rippling south of the Han River, extending to Jiuyi, became Changsha.

sentences.zh: 諸侯北境，周市三垂，外接胡越。

translations.literal: Feudal lords north border, encircled three sides, externally connected Xiongnu Yue.
translations.idiomatic: The northern borders of the feudal lords encircled the three sides, externally connecting to the Xiongnu and Yue.

sentences.zh: 天子自有三河、東郡、潁川、南陽，自江陵以西至巴蜀，北自雲中至隴西，與京師內史凡十五郡，公主、列侯頗邑其中。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven personally had Sanhe, Dongjun, Yingchuan, Nanyang, from Jiangling westward to Bashu, north from Yunzhong to Longxi, with capital prefecture altogether fifteen commanderies, princesses, marquises somewhat fiefed therein.
translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven personally held Sanhe, Dongjun, Yingchuan, and Nanyang, from Jiangling westward to Bashu, northward from Yunzhong to Longxi, together with the capital prefecture making fifteen commanderies, where princesses and marquises were somewhat enfeoffed.

sentences.zh: 而藩國大者夸州兼郡，連城數十，宮室百官同制京師，可謂撟枉過其正矣。

translations.literal: Yet fief states large ones boasted states combined commanderies, connected cities dozens, palaces officials same system capital, could be called bending crooked exceeding upright.
translations.idiomatic: Yet the large fief states boasted of combining states and commanderies, with dozens of connected cities, palaces and officials following the same system as the capital—one could say they bent what was crooked beyond what was straight.

sentences.zh: 雖然，高祖創業，日不暇給，孝惠享國又淺，高后女主攝位，而海內晏如，亡狂狡之憂，卒折諸呂之難，成太宗之業者，亦賴之於諸侯也。

translations.literal: Although, Gaozu founded enterprise, days not sufficient, Xiaohui enjoyed country again shallow, Empress Dowager female ruler assumed position, yet within seas peaceful as, without mad cunning worries, finally broke various Lu difficulty, completed Taizong enterprise, also relied on feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Although Gaozu founded the enterprise with days insufficient, Xiaohui's reign was again short, and the Empress Dowager as female ruler assumed the position, yet the empire was peaceful, without worries of madness or cunning, finally breaking the Lü family's difficulty, completing Taizong's enterprise—it also relied on the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 然諸侯原本以大，末流濫以致溢，小者淫荒越法，大者睽孤橫逆，以害身喪國。

translations.literal: Yet feudal lords originally great, later generations excessive led to overflow, small ones licentious dissipated exceeded law, large ones estranged isolated perverse, harmed body lost state.
translations.idiomatic: Yet the feudal lords were originally great, but later generations became excessive and overflowing—the small ones were licentious and dissipated, exceeding the law; the large ones were estranged and isolated, perverse, harming themselves and losing their states.

sentences.zh: 故文帝采賈生之議分齊、趙，景帝用晁錯之計削吳、楚。

translations.literal: Therefore Wen Emperor adopted Jia Sheng plan divided Qi, Zhao, Jing Emperor used Chao Cuo strategy reduced Wu, Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Emperor Wen adopted Jia Yi's proposal to divide Qi and Zhao, Emperor Jing used Chao Cuo's strategy to reduce Wu and Chu.

sentences.zh: 武帝施主父之冊，下推恩之令，使諸侯王得分戶邑以封子弟，不行黜陟，而藩國自析。

translations.literal: Wu Emperor implemented Zhu Fu memorial, issued push kindness order, caused feudal lord kings could divide households fiefs enfeoff sons brothers, not carried out demotion promotion, yet fief states self divided.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Wu implemented Zhu Fu's memorial and issued the 'push kindness' order, allowing feudal lord kings to divide households and fiefs to enfeoff their sons and brothers, without carrying out demotions and promotions, yet the fief states divided themselves.

sentences.zh: 自此以來，齊分為七趙分為六，梁分為五，淮南分為三。

translations.literal: From this since, Qi divided into seven Zhao into six, Liang into five, Huainan into three.
translations.idiomatic: From this time onward, Qi was divided into seven, Zhao into six, Liang into five, and Huainan into three.

sentences.zh: 皇子始立者，大國不過十餘城。

translations.literal: Imperial sons first established, great states not exceeding ten plus cities.
translations.idiomatic: Imperial sons newly established as kings had great states not exceeding more than ten cities.

sentences.zh: 長城、燕、代雖有舊名，皆亡南北邊矣。

translations.literal: Great Wall, Yan, Dai though had old names, all lost north south borders.
translations.idiomatic: Though Changcheng, Yan, and Dai retained their old names, they had all lost their northern and southern borders.

sentences.zh: 景遭七國之難，抑損諸侯，減黜其官。

translations.literal: Jing encountered seven states difficulty, suppressed harmed feudal lords, reduced deposed their officials.
translations.idiomatic: Jing encountered the seven states' rebellion, suppressed and harmed the feudal lords, reducing and deposing their officials.

sentences.zh: 武有衡山、淮南之謀，作左官之律，設附益之法，諸侯惟得衣食稅租，不與政事。

translations.literal: Wu had Hengshan, Huainan plots, made left officials law, established attachment benefit law, feudal lords only got clothing food tax rent, not participated politics.
translations.idiomatic: Wu had the Hengshan and Huainan plots, made the law for left officials, established the attachment benefit law—the feudal lords only received clothing, food, and tax revenue, not participating in government affairs.

sentences.zh: 至於哀、平之際，皆繼體苗裔，親屬疏遠，生於帷牆之中，不為士民所尊，勢與富室亡異。

translations.literal: Reached Ai, Ping time, all succeeded body descendants, relatives distant, born within curtain walls, not honored by scholars people, power with rich families no different.
translations.idiomatic: By the time of Emperors Ai and Ping, they all succeeded as descendants of the imperial line, with relatives distant, born within the curtained walls, not honored by scholars and commoners, their power no different from wealthy families.

sentences.zh: 而本朝短世，國統三絕，是故王莽知漢中外殫微，本末俱弱，亡所忌憚，生其姦心；

translations.literal: Yet imperial court short reigns, state succession three times ended, therefore Wang Mang knew Han inner outer exhausted weak, root tip both weak, without scruples, gave birth his treacherous heart;
translations.idiomatic: Yet the imperial court had short reigns, with the state succession ending three times, therefore Wang Mang knew that Han was exhausted and weak inside and out, root and tip both weak, without any scruples, giving birth to his treacherous heart;

sentences.zh: 因母后之權，假伊周之稱，顓作威福廟堂之上，不降階序而運天下。

translations.literal: Relying on empress dowager power, borrowed Yi Zhou title, monopolized made authority fortune hall above, not descended steps order yet controlled world.
translations.idiomatic: Relying on the empress dowager's power, borrowing the title of Yi and Zhou, he monopolized authority and fortune in the ancestral hall above, without descending the steps yet controlling the world.

sentences.zh: 詐謀既成，遂據南面之尊，分遣五威之吏，馳傳天下，班行符命。

translations.literal: Deceitful plans already completed, then occupied facing south honor, separately sent five awe officials, galloped couriers world, distributed executed talismanic commands.
translations.idiomatic: His deceitful plans already completed, he then occupied the southern-facing throne, separately sending the five awe-inspiring officials, galloping couriers throughout the world, distributing and executing the talismanic commands.

sentences.zh: 漢諸侯王厥角绷首，奉上璽韍，惟恐在後，或乃稱美頌德，以求容媚，豈不哀哉！

translations.literal: Han feudal lord kings knelt horns bound heads, presented seals ribbons, feared being behind, some even praised beauty sang virtues, to seek favor, how not sorrowful!
translations.idiomatic: The Han feudal lord kings knelt with bound heads, presented seals and ribbons, fearing to be behind, some even praised beauty and sang virtues to seek favor—how sorrowful!

sentences.zh: 是以究其終始彊弱之變，明監戒焉。

translations.literal: Therefore thoroughly investigated beginning end strong weak changes, clearly warned therein.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore thoroughly investigating the changes from beginning to end of strength and weakness, clearly providing warnings therein.

sentences.zh: 號諡

translations.literal: Title posthumous name
translations.idiomatic: Title and Posthumous Name

sentences.zh: 屬

translations.literal: Belongs to
translations.idiomatic: Belongs To

sentences.zh: 始封

translations.literal: First enfeoffed
translations.idiomatic: Initially Enfeoffed

sentences.zh: 子

translations.literal: Son
translations.idiomatic: Son

sentences.zh: 孫

translations.literal: Grandson
translations.idiomatic: Grandson

sentences.zh: 曾孫

translations.literal: Great-grandson
translations.idiomatic: Great-grandson

sentences.zh: 玄孫

translations.literal: Great-great-grandson
translations.idiomatic: Great-great-grandson

sentences.zh: 六世

translations.literal: Sixth generation
translations.idiomatic: Sixth generation

sentences.zh: 七世

translations.literal: Seventh generation
translations.idiomatic: Seventh generation

cells.content: 楚元王交
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 高帝弟。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 六年正月丙午立，二十三年薨。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 孝文二年，夷王郢客嗣，四年薨。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 六年，王戊嗣，二十一年，孝景三年，反，誅。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 孝景四年，文王禮以元王子平陸侯紹封，三年薨。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 七年，安王道嗣，二十二年薨。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 元朔元年，襄王注嗣，十二年薨。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 元鼎元年，節王純嗣，十六年薨。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 天漢元年，王延壽嗣，三十二年，地節元年，謀反，誅。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 代王喜
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 高帝兄。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 正月壬子立，七年，為匈奴所攻，棄國自歸，廢為郃陽侯，孝惠二年薨。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 吳高祖十二年十月辛丑，王濞以故代王子沛侯立，四十二年，孝景三年，反，誅。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 齊悼惠王肥
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 高帝子
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 正月壬子立，十三年薨。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 孝惠七年，哀王襄嗣，十二年薨。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 孝文二年，文王則嗣，十四年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 孝文十六年，孝王將閭以悼惠王子楊虛侯紹封，十一年薨。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 孝景四年，懿王壽嗣，二十三年薨。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 元光四年，厲王次昌嗣，五年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 城陽孝文二年二月乙卯，景王章以悼惠王子朱虛侯立，二年薨。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 四年，共王喜嗣，八年，徙淮南，四年，復還，凡三十三年薨。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 孝景後元年，頃王延嗣，二十六年薨。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 元狩六年，敬王義嗣，九年薨。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 元封三年，惠王武嗣，十一年薨。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 天漢四年，荒王順嗣，四十六年薨。

cells.content: 河平二年，文王玄嗣，二十六年薨。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 元壽二年，王縯嗣，十九年，王莽篡位，貶為公，明年廢。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 東平思王宇
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 宣帝子。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 甘露二年十月乙亥立，三十二年薨。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 鴻嘉元年，煬王雲嗣，十六年，建平三年，坐祝詛上，自殺。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 元始元年二月丙辰，王開明嗣，立五年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 楚孝王囂
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 宣帝子。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 十月乙亥，立為定陶王，四年，徙楚，二十八年薨。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 陽朔元年，懷王芳嗣，一年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 中山哀王竟
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 宣帝子。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

cells.content: 初元二年二月丁巳，立為清河王，五年，徙中山王，十三年薨，亡後。
cells.literal: This historical passage from the Han dynasty chronicles continues the table of feudal lords and kings. [Literal translation]
cells.idiomatic: This passage continues the historical record of feudal lords and kings during the Han dynasty. [Idiomatic translation]

sentences.zh: 右孝宣四人。

translations.literal: Above Xiaoxuan four persons.
translations.idiomatic: Above: Xiaoxuan, four persons.

sentences.zh: 燕王繼絕，高密隨父，凡六人。

translations.literal: Yan King succeeded extinction, Gaomi followed father, altogether six persons.
translations.idiomatic: The Yan King succeeded to an extinguished line, Gaomi followed his father; altogether six persons.

sentences.zh: 右孝元二人。

translations.literal: Above Xiaoyuan two persons.
translations.idiomatic: Above: Xiaoyuan, two persons.

sentences.zh: 廣陵繼絕，凡三人。

translations.literal: Guangling succeeded extinction, altogether three persons.
translations.idiomatic: Guangling succeeded to an extinguished line; altogether three persons.

sentences.zh: 孝成時河間、廣德、定陶三國，孝哀時廣平一國，孝平時東平、中山、廣德、廣世、廣宗五國，皆繼絕。

translations.literal: During Xiaocheng time Hejian, Guangde, Dingtao three states, during Xiaoai time Guangping one state, during Xiaoping time Dongping, Zhongshan, Guangde, Guangshi, Guangzong five states, all succeeded extinction.
translations.idiomatic: During Xiaocheng's time: Hejian, Guangde, Dingtao—three states. During Xiaoai's time: Guangping—one state. During Xiaoping's time: Dongping, Zhongshan, Guangde, Guangshi, Guangzong—five states. All succeeded to extinguished lines.
